title.narrative: Supporting Sustainable Village Development in Sub-Himalayan region of India: Phase III

description.narrative: The project area is in the Himalayan region and is particularly vulnerable to the impacts of climate change specially in terms of changes in rainfall patterns. This threatens food security and agriculture based livelihoods. Therefore the project has taken these pronged approach to achieve it's developmental objectives, assisting communities with climate related adaptation activities, delivering the ideas and experiences of eco-village development (EVD) and transfering it to other villages and supporting inc ome generation activities like marketing of products.The project supports the beneficiary communities to implement climate related coping mechanisms adaptation strategies and simple low-cost technologies that are easily available. Through the course of the project the partner organisations have innovated several appropriate bamboo based solutions that even the local community can be trained to build. To achieve our objectives the following activities will be undertaken:1) Design implement and train local c ommunities in implementing contextualized climate adaptation and women's income generation.2) Use the project results as evidence base example for advocacy efforts for fight against climate change focusing for both local and global decision makers.The loca l governments as well as decission makers of COB meetings are encouraged to use the project results as an example for what can be done on grassroot level.3) Engage in capacity building activities through training and technology transfers.4) Build awareness about environmental issues and how to cope with climate change.5) Assisting in the regeneration of organic agriculture and teach local women how to maintain and manage them.6) Process and preserve locally grown agricultural and horticultural products espe cially in context of increasing their shelf life and value addition.7) Give marketing help.8) Implement activities that have positive impacts on the beneficiaries' livelihood. Examples are teaching them how to weave the bamboo base used in many of the tech nologies implemented such as biogas plants.Some key activities are:1. Rainwater harvesting structures2. Organic farming and compost making3. Women's livelihood generation through marketing 4. Tree plantation5. Promotion of renewable energy6. Smokeless kitc hens7. Organising women's self help groups8. Bamboo based RE-technology
